image.altText: Two women signing Uluru Statement from the Heart

props.synopsis: Speaking to the ABC's Insiders: On Background podcast, constitutional law expert Megan Davis also ruled out supporting any purely symbolic constitutional recognition for Indigenous people, and said it would be a broken promise if the Albanese government were to not proceed with establishing a Makarrata Commission.

title.children: Uluru Statement architect says she was open to calling off Voice referendum after polls showed it would fail

image.altText: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: At a summit examining the harmful effects of social media on child welfare, Mike Burgess delivered warnings about the ease with which young people could be radicalised online, and described the internet as the world's "greatest incubator" of extremism.

title.children: ASIO chief tells social media summit of 'disturbing resurgence' in youth terror cases

image.altText: Destruction left by the Israeli air and ground offensive on the Gaza Strip near Shifa Hospital

props.synopsis: The report accused Israel of deliberately killing, detaining and torturing Palestinian medical staff, of targeting their vehicles and of restricting permits for medical evacuations from Gaza.

title.children: Israel is destroying Gaza's health sector and both sides have tortured people, UN commission says

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: The final stretch of a heated election campaign is being marked by a spat over hurricane funding, disinformation, and a surprise announcement from Melania Trump. But will it change the outcome of the race?

title.children: Melania's bombshell, hurricanes, and disinformation: The home stretch of the US race gets chaotic

image.altText: Toshiyuki Mimaki at a table with three young people, holding a device in his hand and speaking into microphones.

props.synopsis: The 2024 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Japanese Hibakusha organisation Nihon Hidankyo. Hibakusha is the grassroots movement for survivors of the Hiroshima and Nagasaki atomic bombings in 1945.

title.children: Japanese anti-nuclear organisation awarded 2024 Nobel Peace Prize

image.altText: Broken utility poles downed by strong wind gusts.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Milton unleashes a torrent of extreme weather across Florida, with the storm triggering strong winds, dozens of tornadoes and sending seawater in Tampa Bay out to sea.

title.children: Pictures show the trail of destruction left behind by Hurricane Milton and a flurry of tornadoes

image.altText: A teen girl sitting in front of a pink wall

props.synopsis: Now 13, Hiba dreams of being able to go to school, like other girls her age. Instead she sits on the side of the road, surrounded by bombed and broken houses, selling handmade bracelets.

title.children: Inside the life of a 13 year-old girl trying to survive 'a war of hell'

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis vial

props.synopsis: The father of a man who took his own life after being prescribed medicinal cannabis says his family was repeatedly sent more cannabis, despite notifying the telehealth platform of his death. The ABC can reveal the founder of the company has been banned from supplying cannabis and two doctors have been suspended.

title.children: Medicinal cannabis doctors investigated by authorities after suicide and hospitalisation of patients

image.altText: Foreign minister Penny Wong faces the media in Adelaide. 2024-04-06 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Seats are still available on flights departing on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

title.children: Australian government no longer scheduling flights out of Lebanon

image.altText: Ms Kirkland refused to answer a range of questions about abortion as she was quizzed about her views

props.synopsis: An LNP candidate in the Queensland election who previously shared a social media post saying abortion is a "human rights abuse" has repeatedly sidestepped questions on the issue.

title.children: 'We have ruled it out': LNP candidate sidesteps questions about abortion stance during exchange with reporters

image.altText: The Google logo and search bar looking a little old-fashioned but colourful

props.synopsis: A digital repository of billions of web pages, images and books is offline after being hacked, with millions of users' data also stolen.

title.children: Hackers have threatened the internet's 'time machine' — and our digital history

image.altText: a woman looks serious as she speaks to a camera in a corridor of parliament house.

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek has given the reasons for a decision that has stalled a $1bn NSW gold mine, finding "permanent loss" of cultural heritage outweighed the financial cost of stalling the project.

title.children: Billion-dollar gold mine would cause 'irreversible' damage to Aboriginal heritage, says Plibersek

image.altText: A view of a New Zealand Navy vessel on fire as seen from the Samoan coast

props.synopsis: The Manawanui, the New Zealand Navy's specialist dive and hydrographic vessel, sank at a reef off the coast of Samoa that it was surveying.

title.children: NZ defence minister hits out at 'armchair admirals' trolling female captain of sunken navy ship

image.altText: Man speaking in front of microphones to a group of people

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Treasurer hits back after a report of him being a discharged bankrupt 30 years ago is published, calling it an "utterly toxic smear campaign" and a "gutless, grubby attack from people who I frankly expected more of".

title.children: 'Gutless, grubby attack': Liberal treasurer fires back after bankruptcy history unearthed

image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: A French court screens videos of Gisèle Pelicot's abuse after a judge ruled that the public and media could be present when video evidence is screened.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot's alleged rapists come face-to-face with abuse as video evidence shown in public court

image.altText: A pink and yellow hue aurora in the night sky by the beach

props.synopsis: The aurora australis has returned, lighting up the skies in intense colours over southern states. If you missed out on seeing it last night you may get another chance.

title.children: 'Enchanting' aurora display wows photographers and stargazers

image.altText: Two men walk through a field on a farm with blue sky.

props.synopsis: ACTU president Michele O'Neil is calling on the government to reform a temporary working visa scheme that prevents workers leaving bad bosses and to blacklist dodgy employers who use migration worker exploitation as a business model.

title.children: A temporary working visa scheme slammed as a 'modern day slavery risk' urgently needs overhauling, advocates say

image.altText: Clayton Oliver in action for Melbourne

props.synopsis: Melbourne hits back at further speculation Clayton Oliver is on his way out at the Demons, while a pick swap between two clubs sparks considerable interest. Catch up on day five of the AFL trade period with our blog.

title.children: Demons respond to Oliver exit rumour, shock pick swap lights up trade period — as it happened

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone in a studio.

props.synopsis: The long-time Drive presenter tells listeners he has "hogged" the role for long enough and will be leaving ABC Radio Sydney in November.

title.children: After 26 years in 'one of the best jobs' in Australian journalism, Richard Glover is moving on

image.altText: An Australian gymnast competing in 2018.

props.synopsis: Australia's Kate Sayer has achieved a significant distinction by having a skill named in her honour by the International Federation of Gymnastics.

title.children: 'The Sayer': Aussie gymnast recognised with skill named in her honour

image.altText: A woman sitting on a bench, speaking and gesturing.

props.synopsis: The princess joins her husband in Southport, north-west England, to meet the families of several children killed in a stabbing attack there earlier this year.

title.children: Princess Catherine makes surprise appearance in English town rocked by deadly stabbing attack

image.altText: A shoe on the floor of a kitchen is seen from up close

props.synopsis: Ecovacs robot vacuums in multiple US cities were hacked in the space of a few days, with the attacker physically controlling them and yelling obscenities through their onboard speakers.

title.children: Hackers take control of robot vacuums in multiple US cities and abuse owners

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Amelia Saw, who worked for the network's Spotlight program, has taken the company to Federal Court alleging breaches of the Fair Work Act.

title.children: Seven asks for 'salacious' court documents to be kept secret after being sued by former journalist

image.altText: A young man holds up a figurine of Woody the cowboy from Toy Story

props.synopsis: Andre Rebelo's youngest brother tells the WA Supreme Court of the moment he found his mother lying unresponsive under a running shower at the home they shared in the riverside Perth suburb of Bicton.

title.children: Brother of Perth man charged with mother's murder re-enacts moment he found her slumped in shower

image.altText: Headshot of a man wearing dark sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Maurizio Di Ciano, who once ran the restaurant at the WA Italian Club, sexually abused staff aged in their 20s and 30s who were all foreign nationals and recently employed by him.

title.children: Jail for prominent Perth chef and Italian restaurant owner who sexually assaulted three female workers

image.altText: A middle-aged woman looks defiantly at the camera, while holding the handle of a shovel.

props.synopsis: Fed up with the threat of floods, Victorian resident Tuesday Browell is thought to be the first private Australian resident to import war-zone technology to protect her home.

title.children: Why this woman has fortified her bush home with a bulletproof, blast-proof military barrier

image.altText: Silhouhette of a woman against a graphic background of red and blue, with a photo of a corridor in the background.

props.synopsis: The workplace safety regulator finds a new centre for women recovering from domestic, sexual and family violence in regional NSW has exposed its workers to "psychological injury", after the departure of most of its frontline staff.

title.children: Staff blow whistle on 'major' workplace safety concerns at Australian-first DV trauma recovery centre

image.altText: A maroon car stopped in floodwaters. Palms trees in the background are being bent by the wind.

props.synopsis: Ahead of Hurricane Milton making landfall in Florida, fears swirled about EVs bursting into flames if inundated by a storm surge. We examine the facts.

title.children: Are EVs really 'ticking time bombs' in a hurricane?

image.altText: LL Cool J in black New York Yankees cap with arms outstretched, wearing a shiny black leather jacket and gold chains

props.synopsis: Grammy winner LL Cool J says he wanted to do something new with his album The Force by crafting tracks unlike anything you've heard before.

title.children: 'It was underdog music': LL Cool J on how hip hop has evolved

image.altText: a portrait shot of ehtel kennedy in 2020

props.synopsis: The Kennedy family matriarch has been remembered by US leaders as an "American icon".

title.children: Ethel Kennedy, activist and widow of Robert F Kennedy, dies at 96

image.altText: a seated woman in a pink floral dress, smiling

props.synopsis: The friends of Lockyer Valley woman Frances Crawford, who was allegedly murdered by her husband, have remembered her as a "heartfelt" person who "would do anything for anybody".

title.children: Mother-of-three Frances Crawford remembered as 'selfless' as husband's murder charge heard in court

image.altText: Geam On

props.synopsis: Against some of the biggest players in the world of fragrances, an Australian company managed to convince Lionel Messi they were the right people to launch his new product.

title.children: 'We pinch ourselves all the time': How an Aussie company secured a fragrance deal with superstar Lionel Messi

image.altText: A koala inside a small cage

props.synopsis: Conservationists say they are disappointed Transport for NSW made light of a koala wandering through a Sydney train station after it emerged the animal had to be rescued from a home soon after.

title.children: Koala spotted at train station needed second rescue after viral video
